Subject: RE: documents for Relativity 
Date: Thu, 28 Mar 2019 13:01:30 +0000 
Importance: Normal 
)II 
Hello M, 
The documents would need to be converted to a different format. I will talk to someone about getting the documents 
converted to a different format. 
Thank you. 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, March 27,2019 7:15 PM 
To: 
< 
Subject: RE: documents for Relativity 
That's no problem, we don't need those on Relativity. Separately, though will we be able to play those video files *not* 
on a DVD? That is, we only have them in electronic format (in the file folders) —  I haven't tried to play them, so maybe it's 
just as easy as that, but wanted to check if we need to get them processed in some other fashion to be able to view 
independently of a DVD player. 
thanks, 
IM• 
From 
Sent: Tuesday, March 26, 2019 09:32 
To:I 
Cc:1 
Subject: RE: documents for Relativity 
Good Morning M, 
I have noticed that some of these documents contain data that appears to be from a DVD. A DVD contains a bunch of 
separate files to make everything play on a DVD, but it will not make sense to load DVD information into Relativity. The 
following should not be loaded to Relativity: 
1.

From: 
Sent: Monday, March 25, 2019 7:00 PM 
To: 
< 
Subject: RE: documents for Relativity 
Could we please load the documents in the following folder into Relativity for US v. Epstein (USAO tt 2018R01618): 
\\ Usa.doj.gov\ cloud\ NYS \ StAndrews \Shared \ USvEpstein-2018R01618 \ Investigation \It 2018 SDNY investigation \Subpoena 
Returns \ Boies Schiller \ 2019-03-04 Boies Schiller first subpoena response 
In terms of structure, we'd like to create a folder identified as "Subpoena Returns" (at the same level as "FBI Case File" is 
currently), and in a subfolder within Subpoena Returns, a folder titled "BSF returns," and within that a subfolder identified 
as "BSF first production" that the dots in the above link can be deposited into (including any additional subfolders). Does 
that work? 
Please let me know if any questions or if any other information would be helpful, and if you could please let us know 
when it's all uploaded? 
thanks very much, 
Assistant U.S. Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
EFTA00020782
